citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
A principal investigator (PI) performed a procedure outside of the IACUC approved protocol. A non-human primate (NHP)
was identified during routine implant assessment to have cracking and missing acrylic around the border of a cranial
implant, compromising the integrity of the implant. The NHP was placed in a chair and dental cement was added to cover
the exposed portions by the research staff without sedation or anesthesia. The Attending Veterinarian (AV) had not been
consulted to determine if this was a medically necessary procedure, and the IACUC was not notified to seek review and
approval of modification to the protocol. The IACUC is required to approve proposed activities and changes to the
protocol, and an avenue of direct and frequent communication is necessary with the AV. The PI performing this
unapproved procedure could have put the welfare of the animal at risk including potential thermal injury from the addition
of dental cement to an exposed implant. While the veterinary staff concurred with the actions of the research staff, and no
adverse effects were observed, the procedure was not approved in the protocol or performed under veterinary care. The
IACUC shall review and approve, require modifications in, or withhold approval of those components of proposed
activities related to the care and use of animals.
Corrected prior to inspection on 8 December, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
KATHARINE FRANK, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.31(c)(6) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
A principal investigator (PI) performed a procedure outside of the IACUC approved protocol. A non-human primate (NHP) 
was identified during routine implant assessment to have cracking and missing acrylic around the border of a cranial 
implant, compromising the integrity of the implant. The NHP was placed in a chair and dental cement was added to cover 
the exposed portions by the research staff without sedation or anesthesia. The Attending Veterinarian (AV) had not been 
consulted to determine if this was a medically necessary procedure, and the IACUC was not notified to seek review and 
approval of modification to the protocol. The IACUC is required to approve proposed activities and changes to the 
protocol, and an avenue of direct and frequent communication is necessary with the AV. The PI performing this 
unapproved procedure could have put the welfare of the animal at risk including potential thermal injury from the addition 
of dental cement to an exposed implant. While the veterinary staff concurred with the actions of the research staff, and no 
adverse effects were observed, the procedure was not approved in the protocol or performed under veterinary care. The 
IACUC shall review and approve, require modifications in, or withhold approval of those components of proposed 
activities related to the care and use of animals. 
Corrected prior to inspection on 8 December, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
KATHARINE FRANK, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
